isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - BATTERY, CHARGING & CRANKING SYSTEMS - OPERATION - Remote Start Terminal

svcproc.title: Remote Start Terminal
svcproc.para: The remote starter terminal allows an external battery power source to either charge the vehicle batteries or assist in cranking the engine. Connect the external source positive cable to the remote start terminal and the external source negative cable to vehicle frame rail.

To use an external power source to charge the deep cycle battery (with 3+1 system) at the same time as the cranking batteries, a jumper must be used to connect the positive deep cycle battery terminal to the positive terminal of the cranking batteries.
